page.title: 03Landscape Through Our Eyes 2
page.content: I sit near the Millstone Country Hotel I can hear;singing birds,bees buzzing ,noisy cars go on the road.Trees partly camouflaging houses,rows of flowerpots,a rockery within my sight. It is peaceful when no cars pass.A slamming car door breaks the peace. It's a hot day.A phonebox by the bridge was being used by someone now it looks peaceful.Cows eating grass or just sleeping. I'm sitting on a picnic table adjacent to a hotel.On the right there's a road along which one or two cars travel. A couple of seconds more pass;it seems very isolated here at this hotel but very welcoming.A genial breeze suddenly gusts papers flap.Ahead countryside's in view.The sun's hot and is blazing down.On the right are trees.A house is so surrounded by trees it's hardly visible.
